Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Bette Lee Republican National Convention Photographs
Lee, Bette
Lee, Bette
PHOTOS.193
0.25 Linear Feet in 1 folder.
Aug 27, 2004-Sep 2, 2004 Materials are in English The Bette Lee Republican National Convention Photographs document protests against the 2004 Republican National Convention in New York City.
Scope and Content Note
The Bette Lee Republican National Convention Photographs contain 24 photographs shot during the 2004 Republican National Convention in New York City. Captions written by Lee located on the reverse of each photograph identify the various parties depicted.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Processing Information Note
The Bette Lee Republican National Convention Photographs were rehoused in a shared box in February 2013.
Preferred Citation Note
Identification of item, date; Bette Lee Republican National Convention Photographs; PHOTOS 193; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Bette Lee, 2004. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 1950.183, NPA.2004.085, and NPA.2005.001.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Bette Lee were transferred to New York University in 2004 by Bette Lee. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Archives. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu, (212) 998-2630.
Historical/Biographical Note
Photographer and activist Bette Lee began documenting struggles for social justice in 1980. Since then she has photographed peace work, labor struggles, protests for Lesbian, Gay, Bi-Sexual, and Transexual (LGBT) rights, immigrants rights, and campaigns against racism, among other subjects.
Arrangement Note
The Bette Lee Republican National Convention Photographs are ordered chronologically within a single folder.
